item.title: Unit Testing Basics with xUnit and VS 2017 - Part 3 - Notes
Unit Testing Basics with xUnit and VS 2017 - Notes
Setting Up Visual Studio 2017
item.description: During our unit testing workshop there was some confusion over which modules should be installed using the super customizable Visual Studio 2017 installer. In the past Visual Studio installers would give you the ability to do a little customization, but you always ended up with more than you needed. With Visual Studio 2017, if you don’t know what you need you might not end up with enough to actually do anything.

item.title: Getting Started with C# - Implementing Algorithms
item.description: Below are my notes for the December 2016 meetup where we go over the basics of problem solving and implementing algorithms in C#. In this session we talk about implementing algorithms and a problem solving strategy.

item.title: Getting Started with C# - Part 2
item.description: Below are my notes for the November 2016 meetup where we go over the basics of C# and work through some sample problems. We highly recommend that you watch the video series associated with collections and data structures since it is far more complete.

item.title: October 2016 Meetup Notes
item.description: Our October 2016 meetup focused on getting started with C#. We built a basic application, and examined some of the fundamental building blocks of programming: variables, data types, conditions, and iteration. The essential functionality of Xamarin Studio was examined.

item.title: Getting Started with C# - Part 1
item.description: Below are my notes for the October 2016 meetup where we go over the basics of C#, and do an overview of Xamarin Studio. We highly recommend that you watch the video series associated with this material since it is far more complete.

item.title: SOLID Design Principles
item.description:
For the Septemeber 2016 meeting we were delighted to host Eric Downing (of Magic-Wrighter Inc) who presented on SOLID design principles. His slide deck can be accessed here:

http://slides.com/ericdowning/solid-design-principles

JavaScript Basics This workshop is heavily influenced by “JavaScript Basics - Learn Web Development” by MDN. JavaScript is one of the most widely used programming languages today. If you’ve viewed a webpage there is a good chance it used JavaScript. The objective of this workshop is to take you through the steps necessary to setup a basic sandbox to experiment with JavaScript, and to learn just enough JavaScript to be dangerous.
